body:
Of course, i got permission denied (which is normal, because of read-only directory) : 
ERROR : xxxx/: Dir.Mkdir failed to create directory: mkdir /xxxx/untitled : permission denied

after this issue, i have to restart the rclone daemon to be able to browse again the read-only directory.

i have no issue with other directories.

I tried to replicate this, but I haven't succeeded yet.

Please can you post the log from `rclone serve webdav -vv`

Thanks

Hello,

You have to try multiple times (3 or more) to create a file on a read-only directory (chmod 555 for example) to have the issue.
Here is the log :
[log.txt](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/7322028/log.txt)

I haven't managed to make this error message yet

> http: superfluous response.WriteHeader call from golang.org/x/net/webdav.(*Handler).ServeHTTP (webdav.go:74)

Here is what I've been trying

```
$ find . -ls
 20234592      4 drwxrwxr-x   3 ncw      ncw          4096 Oct 11 13:48 .
 20185367      0 lrwxrwxrwx   1 ncw      ncw             6 Oct 11 13:48 ./ro-dir-link -> ro-dir
 20187736      0 -rw-rw-r--   1 ncw      ncw             0 Oct 11 09:53 ./z
 20194330      4 -rw-rw-r--   1 ncw      ncw            29 Oct 11 09:56 ./uploaded
 20234593      4 dr-x------   2 ncw      ncw          4096 Oct 11 09:53 ./ro-dir
 20194326      0 -rw-rw-r--   1 ncw      ncw             0 Oct 11 09:53 ./ro-dir/potato
```

Serve with

```
rclone-v1.56.2 serve -L webdav -vv .
```

List, upload, download

```
$ rclone lsl ':webdav,url="http://localhost:8080/"':
       29 2021-10-11 09:56:07.000000000 uploaded
        0 2021-10-11 09:53:23.000000000 z
        0 2021-10-11 09:53:32.000000000 ro-dir-link/potato
        0 2021-10-11 09:53:32.000000000 ro-dir/potato
```

Upload

```
$ date | rclone rcat --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1 ':webdav,url="http://localhost:8080/"':ro-dir-link/sub/potato2
2021/10/11 13:58:16 ERROR : potato2: Failed to copy: Not Found: 404 Not Found
2021/10/11 13:58:16 ERROR : potato2: Post request rcat error: Not Found: 404 Not Found
2021/10/11 13:58:16 Failed to rcat: Not Found: 404 Not Found
```

Download

```
$ rclone cat --low-level-retries 1 --retries 1 ':webdav,url="http://localhost:8080/"':ro-dir-link/sub/potato2
2021/10/11 13:58:38 ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
2021/10/11 13:58:38 Failed to cat with 2 errors: last error was: directory not found
```

No spurious headers yet even trying each one multiple times.

Can you help?

You are using rclone as server and client.

Could you please use rclone as webdav server (of course) and an other webdav client ? For example Filezilla, cyberduck, panic Transmit, MacOS Finder etc ... ?

When connected to rclone webdav server with Filezilla (for example), I try to create a simple file inside a read only directory.
The 1st time, it failed (normal, it is a read only dir). Then refresh of the directory listing (F5 on windows), it works.
The 2nd time, it failed (normal, it is a read only dir). Then refresh of the directory listing (F5 on windows), it works.
The 3rd  time, it failed (normal, it is a read only dir). Then refresh of the directory listing (F5 on windows), it FAILED.
The 4th time, the error message appears in rclone logs and the refresh of the directory listing (F5 on windows) FAILED.

The following times, The directory listing always FAILED.
Even if i disconnect and reconnect on the client side.

I have to stop rclone server and restart it.

I confirm that when i use rclone as a webdav client i do NOT have the issue.

But i have the issue with at least MacOS Finder, Panic Transmit and Cyberduck (even on Windows).

And, sometimes, i have to repeat multiples times, from 3 or 4 to 10 times (create attempt a file on read-only dir) to have the issue.

When the issue appears and got the first time the error message "superfluous response.WriteHeader", i will be unable to list directory content from webdav client other than rclone (rclone client always work). I got a 207 code - not a VALID dav response.

To be able to list the directory content, i have to restart rclone webdav server.

I've managed to replicate this with Thunar on XFCE using `dav://localhost:8080/`

I'm pretty sure this is a bug in the upstream library `golang.org/x/net/webdav` but I'm not 100% sure yet...

I'll keep looking.

﻿Hi,

I tried to replicate the issue with others filant DAV servers. I was unable to replicate with dave (https://github.com/micromata/dave/releases), sftpgo (https://github.com/drakkan/sftpgo) and this one https://github.com/hacdias/webdav.
Perhaps I didn’t try enough…

Do you have the last golang/dav library built in ?

Thanks.


--
Christophe Yayon

> On 11 Oct 2021, at 19:15, Nick Craig-Wood ***@***.***> wrote:
> ﻿
> I've managed to replicate this with Thunar on XFCE using dav://localhost:8080/
> 
> I'm pretty sure this is a bug in the upstream library golang.org/x/net/webdav but I'm not 100% sure yet...
> 
> I'll keep looking.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

I tried with the latest `golang.org/x/net v0.0.0-20211011170408-caeb26a5c8c0` and rclone beta, and alas have the same result.

I need to dig into the code a bit more to figure out what is going on.

I run into this problem before, after some messing with the golang webdav library and rclone, I believe I found the cause.

When creating webdav server, rclone delegate filesystem operations to vfs, [Mkdir](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/cmd/serve/webdav/webdav.go#L254), [OpenFile](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/cmd/serve/webdav/webdav.go#L254) etc.

The problem is when trying to create a file in a readonly-directory, vfs allocates a [file](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/file.go#L659), (according to my test, first a vfs file node is allocated, and a write handle is returned). When vfs flushes the content via [openPending](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L59), which is in turn called by [Close](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L185) (debug.PrintStack output, I wonder why none of the write related method is called, but perhaps [resp.Body implemented ReadFrom](https://github.com/golang/net/blob/master/webdav/webdav.go#L271)), [rcat will fail](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L71), and [file handle object won't be set](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L203).

Now that's the first part, when browsing the webdav server, client will send PROPFIND request to fetch the directory listing, which calls [walkFS](https://github.com/golang/net/blob/master/webdav/file.go#L758), which in turn open file [read only](https://github.com/golang/net/blob/master/webdav/file.go#L775), however openRead requires a [validObject wait](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/file.go#L511), this check will always fail because

1. The underlying fs.Object is nil, it's only set when [file handle is closed without error](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L203).
2. Time.Sleep won't help, writers are deleted when Close [returned](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write.go#L191).

issue.title: vfs: fix invalid cache object - fixes #5702

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

webdav will fail when the underlying storage is readonly and client issued a request that will modify the underlying storage. This commit will remove the invalid vfs file entry when file is closed so webdav will continue to function.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

[Yes](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5702#issuecomment-964903133)

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [X] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Does this patch included in the last nightly/beta build ?
If yes, which one please ?

> @WeidiDeng - I think that looks like a good fix.
> 
> Do you want to submit a Pull request with that?
> 
> Can you try to make a test for it too? (Might be hard!)

1. I already submit a [pr](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5800).
2. I don't know where to set up the test case, should it be in vfs or webdav?

@WeidiDeng 
> 1. I already submit a [pr](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5800).

Nice - missed that - sorry!

> 2. I don't know where to set up the test case, should it be in vfs or webdav?

I would say this should be a VFS test - that is where the fundamental issue is.

The test should go in here https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/vfs/write_test.go

I think what you'll have to do is create a read only directory on the underlying file system then run your test there.

rclone v1.62.0-DEV
- os/version: darwin 13.2.1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 22.3.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64
- go/version: go1.19.6
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none

The superfluous error is coming on mac while the same webdav is working fine on rclone linux build.
